title: Incomplete disclosures by Apple and Google create “huge blindspot” for 0-day hunters
description: No one mentioned that libwebp, a library found in millions of apps, was a 0-day origin.

title: US to again offer free COVID tests ahead of respiratory virus season
description: On Monday, households can order 4 free tests with shipments expected to start Oct. 2.

title: Independent review finds Mars Sample Return mission important, but broken
description: "MSR was established with unrealistic budget and schedule expectations from the beginning."

title: Don’t throw out those used coffee grounds—use them for 3D printing instead
description: Any object you create can be thrown back into a coffee grinder and reused on a new object.

title: Yelp names and shames businesses paying for 5-star reviews
description: Plus: Amazon announced last week that two fake review brokers were arrested.

title: EU game devs ask regulators to look at Unity’s “anti-competitive” bundling
description: Company's power is a "market failure" with "significant vendor lock risk" for devs.

title: The Pixel Fold’s screen repair will cost $900
description: All the displays, cameras, batteries, and back plate are now for sale.

title: AI-generated books force Amazon to cap ebook publications to 3 per day
description: "In order to help protect against abuse, we are lowering the volume limits we have in place."

title: New study looks again at how alcohol influences attraction
description: Yet another look into how alcohol influences interactions with the desired sex.

title: Google sued over fatal Google Maps error after man drove off broken bridge
description: Google allegedly gave drivers bridge route for years despite correction requests.

title: Microsoft overhauls its pricey Surface Laptop Studio with new CPU, GPU, and RAM
description: Laptop launches October 3; starts at $2,000 and gets more expensive from there.

title: Microsoft’s new Surface Laptop Go 3 is officially no longer a budget PC
description: The Surface Go tablet also gets an update, but only for business customers.

title: Next major Windows update is available September 26, with new AI (and not-AI) features
description: Passkeys, Paint, Backup, and other app updates make this a significant release.

title: Jaguar jettisions CCS charger plug, negotiates Tesla Supercharger access
description: Jaguars will sport native North American Charging Standard plugs from 2025.

title: Judge “in a pickle” after Google demands DOJ stop sharing public trial exhibits
description: Google continues fight to block public access to key facts in monopoly trial.

title: What can we do about ultraprocessed foods?
description: Researchers are figuring out the features of these foods that harm our health.

title: Amazon’s generative-AI-powered Alexa is as big a privacy red flag as old Alexa
description: Amazon wants you to use Alexa more. But can you trust it?
